title: Authors and Citation
text: Kevin Potter. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Potter K (2023). ffcar: Functions Creating Analysis Reports. R package version 1.0.1, https://rettopnivek.github.io/ffcar/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ffcar: Functions for Creating Analysis Reports},   author = {Kevin Potter},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.1},   url = {https://rettopnivek.github.io/ffcar/}, }

title: Functions for Creating Analysis Reports
text: R package ffcar provides collection functions help create basic analysis report using Rmarkdown R package flextable.

title: Functions for Creating Analysis Reports
text: Prerequisites Installation Usage

title: Functions for Creating Analysis Reports
text: R (version >= 4.2.1) flextable (version >= 0.9.0) easy installation recommended devtools (version >= 2.4.3)

title: Functions for Creating Analysis Reports
Functions for Creating Analysis Reports
text: can load package easily access functions: ffcar_flextable function allows one quickly create basic APA-style table using flextable minimal formatting effort: ffcar_reformat_columns function allows one combine format summary results new column: ffcar_transfer_results_to_table function makes easier combine results across different analyses single table: ffcar_design_table function provides flexible way create table summarizing different subsets data set, especially useful creating sample characteristics tables: functions ffcar_conditional_statement ffcar_sub_in_content can used create text content subs results tests conditionally adapts content based results (useful constructing reports can easily updated data changes):
code: library(ffcar) # Example data set data(mtcars) dtf_example <- mtcars[1:4, 1:3]  # Create APA-style table obj_flex <- ffcar_flextable(   dtf_example,   c( 'Miles per gallon', 'Cylinders', 'Displacement' ) ) obj_flex # Example data set data(anscombe) # Anscombe's quartet # Fit linear model obj_lm_fit <- lm(   y1 ~ x1, data = anscombe ) # Summary of results mat_summary <- summary( obj_lm_fit )$coefficients dtf_summary <- data.frame( Term = c( 'Intercept', 'Slope' ) ) # Create nicely formatted column dtf_summary$Test <- ffcar_reformat_columns(   mat_summary, c(1:2, 4),  '[[GLb]] = [[C1]] (SE = [[C2]]), p = [[C3]]',  int_digits = c( 2, 2, 3 ) ) dtf_summary # List of matrices with regression results lst_results <- list(   A1 = summary( lm( y1 ~ x1, data = anscombe ) )$coefficients,   A2 = summary( lm( y2 ~ x2, data = anscombe ) )$coefficients,   A3 = summary( lm( y3 ~ x3, data = anscombe ) )$coefficients,   A4 = summary( lm( y4 ~ x4, data = anscombe ) )$coefficients )  # Initialize table dtf_table <- data.frame(   Estimate = NA,   SE = NA,   P_value = NA )  # Extract the 2nd row and columsn 1, 2, and 4 from each analysis summary dtf_table <- ffcar_transfer_results_to_table(   lst_results, dtf_table,   obj_rows = 2, obj_columns = c(1:2, 4),   obj_labels = c( 'Estimate', 'SE', 'P_value' ) )  # Anscombe's classic result showing how  # very different data can produce very  # similar regression results dtf_table # Create summary table dtf_table <- ffcar_design_table(   # Data set   mtcars,   # Subsets of data (determines # of columns)   list(     Overall = rep( TRUE, nrow(mtcars) ),     Cylinders_4 = mtcars$cyl %in% 4,     Cylinders_6 = mtcars$cyl %in% 6,     Cylinders_8 = mtcars$cyl %in% 8   ),   # Rows   # list( Label, Column, Summary, Digits, Category )   list( 'Sample size',         'mpg', '[[N]]' ),   list( 'Miles per gallon; M (SD)',         'mpg', '[[M]] ([[SD]])', 1 ),   list( 'Weight (10[[SP3]] lbs); M (SD)',         'wt', '[[M]] ([[SD]])', 1 ),   list( 'Transmission; % automatic (N)',         'am', '[[P]]% ([[C]])', 1, 0 ) ) dtf_table[,-(2:5)] # Test for different in MPG by car cylinder lst_ttest <- t.test(   mtcars$mpg[mtcars$cyl %in% 4],    mtcars$mpg[mtcars$cyl %in% 6] )  chr_results <- paste0(   '4-cylinder cars [[V1]] significantly more miles to the gallon ',   'compared to 6-cylinder cars, t([[V2]]) = [[V3]], p = [[V4]].' ) chr_values <- c(   V1 = ffcar_conditional_statement(     # Check for significant p-values and      # lower MPG for 4-cylinder cars     lst_ttest$p.value < .05 & diff(lst_ttest$estimate) < 0,      c(      'did not get', # If not significant or wrong direction     'got' # If significant and right direction     )   ),   V2 = round( as.numeric( lst_ttest$parameter ) ), # Degrees of freedom   V3 = round( as.numeric( lst_ttest$statistic ), 2 ), # Test statistic   V4 = format( round( lst_ttest$p.value, 3 ), nsmall = 3 ) ) chr_results <- ffcar_sub_in_content( chr_results, chr_values ) chr_results

what: Functions for Creating Analysis Reports — ffcar-package
title: Functions for Creating Analysis Reports — ffcar-package
text: ffcar package provides assorted functions help variety common tasks creating analysis reports. See https://rettopnivek.github.io/ffcar/ details.

text: character vector.

what: Return Statement Based on Logical Value — ffcar_conditional_statement
title: Return Statement Based on Logical Value — ffcar_conditional_statement
text: Function return one two possible statements based whether logical value TRUE FALSE. Useful, example, automatically generate statements regarding statistical significance.

title: Return Statement Based on Logical Value — ffcar_conditional_statement
Return Statement Based on Logical Value — ffcar_conditional_statement
text: lgc_condition logical value. chr_statement character vector two strings, 1 statement return FALSE 2 statement return TRUE. Defaults statement statistical significance.

title: Return Statement Based on Logical Value — ffcar_conditional_statement
text: character string.

title: Return Statement Based on Logical Value — ffcar_conditional_statement
code: ffcar_conditional_statement( FALSE ) #> [1] "not statistically significant" ffcar_conditional_statement( TRUE ) #> [1] "statistically significant"  # Custom statements ffcar_conditional_statement(   FALSE, c( 'non-significant', 'significant' ) ) #> [1] "non-significant" ffcar_conditional_statement(   TRUE, c( 'non-significant', 'significant' ) ) #> [1] "significant"

what: Create RMarkdown File for Report — ffcar_create_report
title: Create RMarkdown File for Report — ffcar_create_report
text: Function initialize .Rmd file ffcar-compatible report.

title: Create RMarkdown File for Report — ffcar_create_report
code: ffcar_create_report(   chr_file_name,   chr_date = NULL,   chr_title = "Analysis Report",   chr_author = "Kevin Potter" )

title: Create RMarkdown File for Report — ffcar_create_report
text: chr_file_name character string, file name report. chr_date character vector, date file name date report header, respectively. chr_title character string, title report. chr_author character string, author(s) report.

title: Create RMarkdown File for Report — ffcar_create_report
text: .Rmd file.

Create Folders and Subfolders for Report — ffcar_create_report_folder

code: ffcar_ymd_hm() #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’ ffcar_ymd() #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’ ffcar_mdy() #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’

what: Design a Table with Summmary Statistics — ffcar_design_table
title: Design a Table with Summmary Statistics — ffcar_design_table
text: Function provide flexible means creating table summary statistics data set (e.g., useful creating sample characteristics tables).

title: Design a Table with Summmary Statistics — ffcar_design_table
Design a Table with Summmary Statistics — ffcar_design_table
text: dtf_data data frame values summarize . lst_subsets list logical vectors (matching length number rows dtf_data) specifying subsets data summarize . Multiple logical vectors result creation separate columns summary statistics (one logical vector). names columns summary statistics set list names. ... Additional lists specifying rows include table. list format : list( 'Label', 'Column name', 'Statistics', Digits,   'Category' ). character string row label formatted using function ffcar_sub_in_content. character string column name specifies column dtf_data summary statistics computed . character string type statistics compute passed syntax argument function ffcar_summa. integer digits indicates number decimal places summary statistics round . final element list allows users specify categories match create binary variable computing proportions, percentages, /frequencies (otherwise column must already consist TRUE FALSE values). Elements list must specified order; however, fewer 5 elements can specified. example, create row consists label, users can simply provide list single character string.

title: Design a Table with Summmary Statistics — ffcar_design_table
text: data frame.

title: Design a Table with Summmary Statistics — ffcar_design_table
code: # Example data set data(mtcars)  # Create summary table dtf_table <- ffcar_design_table(   # Data set   mtcars,   # Subsets of data (determines # of columns)   list(     Overall = rep( TRUE, nrow(mtcars) ),     Cylinders_4 = mtcars$cyl %in% 4,     Cylinders_6 = mtcars$cyl %in% 6,     Cylinders_8 = mtcars$cyl %in% 8   ),   # Rows   # list( Label, Column, Summary, Digits, Category )   list( 'Sample size',         'mpg', '[[N]]' ),   list( 'Miles per gallon; M (SD)',         'mpg', '[[M]] ([[SD]])', 1 ),   list( 'Weight (10[[SP3]] lbs); M (SD)',         'wt', '[[M]] ([[SD]])', 1 ),   list( 'Transmission; % automatic (N)',         'am', '[[P]]% ([[C]])', 1, 0 ) ) dtf_table[,-(2:5)] #>                           Label    Overall Cylinders_4 Cylinders_6 Cylinders_8 #> 1                   Sample size         32          11           7          14 #> 2      Miles per gallon; M (SD)   20.1 (6)  26.7 (4.5)  19.7 (1.5)  15.1 (2.6) #> 3      Weight (10³ lbs); M (SD)    3.2 (1)   2.3 (0.6)   3.1 (0.4)     4 (0.8) #> 4 Transmission; % automatic (N) 59.4% (19)   27.3% (3)   57.1% (4)  85.7% (12)

title: Create APA-Style Flextable Object — ffcar_flextable
text: Function creates APA-style table using flextable::flextable().

title: Create APA-Style Flextable Object — ffcar_flextable
code: ffcar_flextable(   dtf_table,   chr_header_row_1,   chr_header_row_2 = NULL,   chr_header_row_3 = NULL,   lst_alignment = NULL,   int_font_size = 11,   chr_font_family = "Arial",   lgc_color_rows = NULL,   chr_row_color = NULL,   lgc_merge_header_cells = TRUE )

title: Create APA-Style Flextable Object — ffcar_flextable
text: dtf_table data frame table content. chr_header_row_1 character vector matching length number columns dtf_table, headers columns. chr_header_row_2 character vector matching length number columns dtf_table, optional second line column headers. chr_header_row_3 character vector matching length number columns dtf_table, optional third line column headers. lst_alignment named list consisting elements left, center, /right, consisting column indices apply corresponding alignment. int_font_size integer value, font size table. chr_font_family character string, font family. lgc_color_rows logical vector matching length number rows dtf_table, specifying rows colored. chr_row_color character string giving optional background color rows. input provided lgc_color_rows, results every row colored. lgc_merge_header_cells logical value; TRUE merges equivalent header cells single cell.

title: Create APA-Style Flextable Object — ffcar_flextable
text: flextable object.

title: Create APA-Style Flextable Object — ffcar_flextable
text: Miles per gallon Cylinders Displacement 21 6 160 21 6 160 22.8 4 108 21.4 6 258
code: data(mtcars) dtf_example <- mtcars[1:4, 1:3] ft <- ffcar_flextable(   dtf_example,   c( 'Miles per gallon', 'Cylinders', 'Displacement' ) ) ft title: Save PNG File — ffcar_png
text: Function save PNG file using default options.

title: Save PNG File — ffcar_png
code: ffcar_png(   chr_file_name,   num_width = 5,   num_height = 5,   chr_units = "in",   int_res = 300 )

title: Save PNG File — ffcar_png
text: chr_file_name character string, path file. num_width numeric value, width image (default assumed inches). num_height numeric value, height image (default assumed inches). chr_units character string, units width height (default '' inches). int_res integer value, resolution image ppi (pixels per inch).

title: Save PNG File — ffcar_png
text: figure saved specified path.

title: Save PNG File — ffcar_png
text: academic journals expect figures dimensions either 5 7.25 inches require high-resolution images (typically 300 ppi).

title: Pull Values From Matrix — ffcar_pull_from_matrix
text: Function extract values specified set rows columns matrix. Useful, example, pulling results coefficients matrix returned base::summary() working lm glm objects.

title: Pull Values From Matrix — ffcar_pull_from_matrix
Pull Values From Matrix — ffcar_pull_from_matrix
text: mat_values matrix. int_rows integer vector, rows subset. int_columns integer vector, columns subset. chr_labels character vector matching length int_columns, optional new labels extracted columns.

title: Pull Values From Matrix — ffcar_pull_from_matrix
text: subset rows mat_values.

title: Pull Values From Matrix — ffcar_pull_from_matrix
code: # Example data set data( "mtcars" ) # Multiple regression summary mat_coefficients <-   summary( lm( mpg ~ wt + cyl + hp, data = mtcars ) )$coefficients # Pull estimates, standard errors, and p-values ffcar_pull_from_matrix(   mat_coefficients,   int_rows = 2:4, int_columns = c(1:2, 4),   chr_labels = c( 'Estimate', 'SE', 'P_value' ) ) #>       Estimate         SE      P_value #> wt  -3.1669731 0.74057588 0.0001994765 #> cyl -0.9416168 0.55091638 0.0984800975 #> hp  -0.0180381 0.01187625 0.1400151550  # Applied over multiple analyses lst_summaries <- list(   wt = summary( lm( mpg ~ wt, data = mtcars ) )$coefficients,   cyl = summary( lm( mpg ~ cyl, data = mtcars ) )$coefficients,   hp = summary( lm( mpg ~ hp, data = mtcars ) )$coefficients )  dtf_summary <- sapply(   lst_summaries, ffcar_pull_from_matrix,   int_rows = 2, int_columns = c(1:2, 4),   chr_labels = c( 'Estimate', 'SE', 'P_value' ) ) |> t()

what: Reformat Columns in Data Frame — ffcar_reformat_columns
title: Reformat Columns in Data Frame — ffcar_reformat_columns
text: Function reformat columns data frame results (e.g., combining different columns nicely formatted character strings results).

title: Reformat Columns in Data Frame — ffcar_reformat_columns
code: ffcar_reformat_columns(   dtf_results,   vec_columns,   chr_template = NULL,   fun_transform = NULL,   int_digits = NULL,   lgc_pad = TRUE,   chr_common = "estimate and standard error" )

title: Reformat Columns in Data Frame — ffcar_reformat_columns
text: dtf_results data frame values format. vec_columns vector column indices, either integers character strings. chr_template character string giving desired format results. Specify columns using '[[CX]]' X refers column number. See ffcar_unicode_lookup details. fun_transform function, optional transformation apply formatting (e.g., applying exp function convert log-odds odds ratios). int_digits integer vector giving number digits round extracted column. chr_common character string, allows quick specification common templates (uncertainty intervals, estimates standard errors, frequencies percentages, p-values).

title: Reformat Columns in Data Frame — ffcar_reformat_columns
text: data frame.

title: Reformat Columns in Data Frame — ffcar_reformat_columns
code: dtf_results <- data.frame(   Estimate.raw = rnorm( 3 ),   SE.raw = exp( rnorm( 3 ) ) ) dtf_results$P_value.raw <- pnorm(   abs( dtf_results$Estimate )/dtf_results$SE.raw, lower.tail = FALSE )*2 dtf_results$Test <- ffcar_reformat_columns(   dtf_results, 1:3,   '[[GLb]] = [[C1]] (SE = [[C2]]), p = [[C3]]',   int_digits = c( 2, 2, 3 ) ) print( dtf_results ) #>   Estimate.raw    SE.raw P_value.raw                             Test #> 1    1.4373960 4.0886482   0.7251699  β = 1.44 (SE = 4.09), p = 0.725 #> 2   -1.1603803 0.7966326   0.1452250 β = -1.16 (SE = 0.80), p = 0.145 #> 3   -0.2169075 0.7079206   0.7592994 β = -0.22 (SE = 0.71), p = 0.759

what: Substitute Content for Placeholder Text — ffcar_sub_in_content
title: Substitute Content for Placeholder Text — ffcar_sub_in_content
text: Function substitute content based placeholder text character string.

title: Substitute Content for Placeholder Text — ffcar_sub_in_content
code: ffcar_sub_in_content(   chr_string,   chr_values = NULL,   chr_brackets = c("[[", "]]") )

title: Substitute Content for Placeholder Text — ffcar_sub_in_content
text: chr_string character string placeholder text replace. chr_values named character vector (vector can coerced character vector) elements substitute based similarly labeled placeholder text. chr_brackets character vector left right bracketing symbols used denote text replace.

title: Substitute Content for Placeholder Text — ffcar_sub_in_content
text: character string placeholder text replaced relevant content.

title: Substitute Content for Placeholder Text — ffcar_sub_in_content
code: string <-   'Results were significant, [[GLb]] = [[VCE]]' %paste%   ' (SE = [[VSE]]), p = [[VPV]].' # Named vector with names matching placeholder # text to replace values <- c( VCE = '1.0', VSE = '0.2', VPV = '0.002' ) ffcar_sub_in_content( string, values ) #> [1] "Results were significant, β = 1.0 (SE = 0.2), p = 0.002."

title: Flexible Formatted Summary Statistics — ffcar_summa
text: Function creates nicely formatted character strings summary statistics based user-supplied identifiers via simple, intuitive syntax.

title: Flexible Formatted Summary Statistics — ffcar_summa
code: ffcar_summa(   vec_values,   chr_syntax = "[[M]] ([[SD]])",   lgc_remove_NA = TRUE,   int_digits = 2,   lgc_pad = FALSE,   vec_categories = NULL,   fun_custom = NULL,   ... )

title: Flexible Formatted Summary Statistics — ffcar_summa
text: vec_values vector values. chr_syntax character string identifiers form [[.]] . can variety letter sets different summary statistics. function substitute appropriate summary statistic computed Vec_values place identifier. lgc_remove_NA Logical; TRUE removes NA values computing statistics. int_digits integer value - number digits round . lgc_pad Logical; TRUE pads decimal places zeros needed. vec_categories vector values match vec_values certain statistics (e.g., percentages, counts). fun_custom optional user-defined function takes vec_values first argument returns vector values. -th outputted value substituted corresponding identifier [[]]. ... Additional arguments user-defined function.

title: Flexible Formatted Summary Statistics — ffcar_summa
text: character string.

title: Flexible Formatted Summary Statistics — ffcar_summa
text: function provides simple syntax allow users write custom phrase reporting summary statistics. function searches input identifiers - found, function computes appropriate summary statistic substitues numeric result place given identifier. example, user can provide phrase: 'Mean = [[M]]', function substitute sample mean vec_values identifier [[M]]. Pre-defined identifiers : [[N]] = Sample size; [[M]] = Mean; [[SD]] = Standard deviation; [[SE]] = Standard error mean; [[Mn]] = Minimum; [[Q1]] = 1st quartile; [[Md]] = Median; [[Q3]] = 2nd quartile; [[Mx]] = Maximum; [[IQR]] = Inter-quartile range; [[C]] = Counts/frequencies; [[P]] = Percent; [[Pr]] = Proportion. Users can also pass custom function f takes x first argument returns vector values. element outputted vector substituted identifier [[]].

title: Flexible Formatted Summary Statistics — ffcar_summa
code: # Example using 'iris' data set data("iris") # Continuous variable - sepal length x <- iris$Sepal.Length  # Mean and standard deviation ffcar_summa(x) #> [1] "5.84 (0.83)" # Median and IQR ffcar_summa(x, "[[Md]] ([[IQR]])") #> [1] "5.8 (1.3)" # Pad to 2 decimal places ffcar_summa(x, "[[Md]] ([[IQR]])", lgc_pad = TRUE) #> [1] "5.80 (1.30)" # Mean (SD); N [min, 1st, 2nd, and 3rd quartile, max] ffcar_summa(x, paste0(     "[[N]]; [[M]] ([[SD]]); ",     "[[[Mn]], [[Q1]], [[Md]], [[Q3]], [[Mx]]]"   ), int_digits = 1) #> [1] "150; 5.8 (0.8); [4.3, 5.1, 5.8, 6.4, 7.9]"  # Custom measures via user-defined function # Geometric mean fun_geometric <- function(x) {   exp( mean( log(x) ) ) } ffcar_summa(x, "[[M]] vs. [[1]]",   fun_custom = fun_geometric ) #> [1] "5.84 vs. 5.79"  # Example using 'mtcars' data set # Categorical variable - # of forward gears data("mtcars") x <- mtcars$gear  # Percent and counts for 3 forward gears ffcar_summa(x == 3, "[[P]]% ([[C]] out of [[N]])") #> [1] "46.88% (15 out of 32)" # Percent and counts for 4 or 5 forward gears ffcar_summa(x, "[[P]]% ([[C]] out of [[N]])",   vec_categories = c(4, 5) ) #> [1] "53.12% (17 out of 32)"

what: Transfer Results From List to Table — ffcar_transfer_results_to_table
title: Transfer Results From List to Table — ffcar_transfer_results_to_table
text: Given list multiple summaries model estimates, transfers specified rows columns new data frame. Useful, example, multiple summaries lm glm objects exist user wants summaries single table.

title: Transfer Results From List to Table — ffcar_transfer_results_to_table
code: ffcar_transfer_results_to_table(   lst_results,   dtf_table,   obj_rows,   obj_columns,   obj_labels )

title: Transfer Results From List to Table — ffcar_transfer_results_to_table
text: lst_results list matrices containing result summaries. dtf_table data frame, table add results . obj_rows Either () integer vector specifying rows index matrix lst_results, (b) different rows extracted matrix, list matching length lst_results specific rows index per matrix. obj_columns Either () integer vector specifying columns index matrix lst_results, (b) different columns extracted matrix, list matching length lst_results specific columns index per matrix. obj_labels Either () character vector specifying columns update dtf_table, (b) different columns dtf_table updated matrix lst_results, list matching length lst_results specific columns update.

title: Transfer Results From List to Table — ffcar_transfer_results_to_table
text: data frame.

title: Transfer Results From List to Table — ffcar_transfer_results_to_table
code: # List of matrices with regression results lst_results <- list(   wt = summary( lm( mpg ~ wt, data = mtcars ) )$coefficients,   cyl = summary( lm( mpg ~ cyl, data = mtcars ) )$coefficients,   hp = summary( lm( mpg ~ hp, data = mtcars ) )$coefficients )  dtf_table <- data.frame(   Estimate = NA,   SE = NA,   P_value = NA )  dtf_table <- ffcar_transfer_results_to_table(   lst_results, dtf_table,   obj_rows = 2, obj_columns = c(1:2, 4),   obj_labels = c( 'Estimate', 'SE', 'P_value' ) ) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’

title: Unicode Lookup Table — ffcar_unicode_lookup
text: Function returns useful unicode shorthand labels easy lookup. Note certain systems, code points used may render properly.

title: Unicode Lookup Table — ffcar_unicode_lookup
Unicode Lookup Table — ffcar_unicode_lookup
text: named character vector unicode associated shorthand labels.

title: Unicode Lookup Table — ffcar_unicode_lookup
code: # Greek letters ffcar_unicode_lookup() %with_name% 'GL' #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’ # Superscripts ffcar_unicode_lookup() %with_name% 'SP' #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’ # Subscripts ffcar_unicode_lookup() %with_name% 'SB' #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’ # Math symbols ffcar_unicode_lookup() %with_name% 'MS' #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’ # Error bar symbols ffcar_unicode_lookup() %with_name% 'EB' #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’

what: Update Report From Content in List — ffcar_update_report_from_list
title: Update Report From Content in List — ffcar_update_report_from_list
text: Given list lists specifying inputs 'add' functions Ffcar, append new content .Rmd file.

title: Update Report From Content in List — ffcar_update_report_from_list
Update Report From Content in List — ffcar_update_report_from_list
text: lst_report list lists. sublist contains first, character string specifying 'add' function call, either 'header', 'paragraph', 'code', 'figure', 'table', 'link', 'table_of_contents'. Second, sublist contains character string form 'X_Y', X label denoting section 'Y' number 1 5 denoting section level. Finally, remainder list consists inputs pass specified 'add' function. chr_rmd_file character string, name .Rmd file update. int_max_TOC_level integer value, maximum number tabs delineate subsections (value 1 6).

title: Update Report From Content in List — ffcar_update_report_from_list
text: Updated content file specified chr_rm_file.

what: Convert Variable Names to Labels — ffcar_variables_to_labels
title: Convert Variable Names to Labels — ffcar_variables_to_labels
text: Function convert variable names (e.g., columns data frame, predictors used regression) nice labels.

title: Convert Variable Names to Labels — ffcar_variables_to_labels
code: ffcar_variables_to_labels(   chr_variables,   chr_remove = NULL,   chr_space = "ZZ",   int_skip = -1 )

title: Convert Variable Names to Labels — ffcar_variables_to_labels
text: chr_variables character vector, variable names convert nice labels. chr_remove optional character vector, string patterns remove. Defaults 'PRD', '', 'COL'. chr_space character string, pattern replace empty space. int_skip optional integer vector values 1 12 indicating specifc patterns skip.

title: Convert Variable Names to Labels — ffcar_variables_to_labels
text: character vector nicely formatted labels.

title: Convert Variable Names to Labels — ffcar_variables_to_labels
code: # Parentheses ffcar_variables_to_labels( 'PRDGroupZZOPPTreatmentCLP' ) #> [1] "Group (Treatment)" # Square brackets ffcar_variables_to_labels( 'PRDGroupZZOPBTreatmentCLB' ) #> [1] "Group [Treatment]" # Hyphen ffcar_variables_to_labels( 'PRDShortHPHterm' ) #> [1] "Short-term" # Colon ffcar_variables_to_labels( 'PRDGroupCLNZZTreatment' ) #> [1] "Group: Treatment" # Semicolon ffcar_variables_to_labels( 'PRDGroupSMCZZTreatment' ) #> [1] "Group; Treatment" # Pipe symbol ffcar_variables_to_labels( 'PRDPOPPAPPEBCLP' ) #> [1] "P(A|B)" # Plus, minus, and equal signs ffcar_variables_to_labels( 'PRDXZZEQLZZYZZPLSZZZ' ) #> [1] "X = Y + Z" # Hash sign ffcar_variables_to_labels( 'PRDHSHZZofZZcounts' ) #> [1] "# of counts"

what: Operator to Index Sublists in a List — %pull_sublist%
title: Operator to Index Sublists in a List — %pull_sublist%
text: Operator returns content sublist specified level list lists.

title: Operator to Index Sublists in a List — %pull_sublist%
Operator to Index Sublists in a List — %pull_sublist%
text: obj_levels Either character vector names sublists integer vector indices. lst_content list lists.

title: Operator to Index Sublists in a List — %pull_sublist%
text: element(s) lhs whose names contain rhs character string.

title: Operator to Index Sublists in a List — %pull_sublist%
code: # List with 1 nested level lst <- list(   SL1 = list( A = 1, B = 2, C = 3 ),   SL2 = list( A = 4, B = 5, C = 6 ) ) # Extract element 'A' from each sublist lst %pull_sublist% 'A' #> [[1]] #> [1] 1 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 4 #>  # Extract 1st element from each sublist lst %pull_sublist% 1 #> [[1]] #> [1] 1 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 4 #>  # Extract element 'B' from each sublist lst %pull_sublist% 'B' #> [[1]] #> [1] 2 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 5 #>  # Extract 2nd element from each sublist lst %pull_sublist% 2 #> [[1]] #> [1] 2 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 5 #>   # List with two nested levels lst <- list(   SL1 = list(     SL11 = list( A = 1, B = 2 ),     SL12 = list( A = 3, B = 4 )   ),   SL2 = list(     SL21 = list( A = 5, B = 6 ),     SL22 = list( A = 7, B = 8 )   ) ) # Extract 1st element from level 1 (SLX1) lst %pull_sublist% 1 #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$A #> [1] 1 #>  #> [[1]]$B #> [1] 2 #>  #>  #> [[2]] #> [[2]]$A #> [1] 5 #>  #> [[2]]$B #> [1] 6 #>  #>  # Extract 1st element from level 2 (SLX2[[1]]) lst %pull_sublist% c( 2, 1 ) #> [[1]] #> [1] 3 #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] 7 #>

title: Operator to Index Vector by Names — %with_name%

title: Operator to Index Vector by Names — %with_name%
code: x <- c( A1 = 1, A2 = 2, B1 = 3, B2 = 4 ) x %with_name% 'A' #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’ x %with_name% 'B' #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘checkmate’
